title: Brothers hospitalised for sunburn blisters from daycare | The
text:
WARNING: GRAPHIC IMAGES
TWO brothers have been rushed to hospital with horrific burns and blisters after day care centre workers allegedly let them play shirtless in 50C heat without sunscreen.
Conner Harvey, seven, and Tray Wells, five, suffered third and second-degree burns after spending the day at a water park in the US state of Oklahoma on Friday.
The boys’ devastated aunt, Amanda Harvey, shared images of their horrific burns on Facebook.
One picture shows red-headed Conner’s back covered in sores with one enormous blister erupting from his skin.
“My oldest is a redhead so he’s more fair-skinned and his burn was much worse,” the boys’ mother, Shaunna Broadway, said.
My poor nephews left outside while they were at HAPPINESS DAYCARE IN VINITA! MOM AND BABIES ARE AT THE HOSPITAL NOW
Posted by Amanda Harvey on Saturday, July 25, 2015 Ms Broadway said she picked up her sons from Happiness Is a Learning Centre on Friday and found them burnt and crying in pain.
She said staff told her they asked the boys to keep their clothes on as the water park didn’t supply sunscreen, but they refused.
“It was common sense that they shouldn’t have been out in the sun all day, even if they wore their clothes,” Ms Broadway told BuzzFeed.
“The heat index was 118 degrees Fahrenheit (48C) in Vinita that day. The news was telling us not to be outside.”
Ms Broadway called a local hospital that evening who said they couldn’t do much until the burns blistered.
Brothers hospitalised for severe burns (Frame content direct link: https://www.youtube.com/embed/nKUZaG8FmWM .)
When the recommended Silvadene cream and pain medications did little to ease the pain, she took her sons to hospital the next day to have the excruciating boils and blisters lanced.
On Sunday, Ms Broadway rushed her boys to Hillcrest Medical Centre in Tulsa when one complained of chest pains.
“Apparently the swelling and pain on his back was so bad that he was having pressure on his chest,” she said.
They were later flown to Shriners Hospital for Children in Galveston, Texas, for emergency treatment. Suffering ... Conner, seven (left) and Trey, five, receive treatment in hospital for severe sunburn. Picture: GoFundMe/Jerry Broadway Source: Supplied
Ms Broadway said she filed a police report on Sunday and is looking for a lawyer.
Police said they are investigating.
“Their wounds are being cleaned and the dead skin removed while they keep the boys heavily sedated. They’re getting better but it’s definitely taking time and it’s been really hard seeing them in so much pain and not sleeping … it’s a lot for a mum right now,” Ms Broadway said.
“My kids need a voice — I’m that voice, and I just want justice for them. And I don’t want this to ever happen to anyone else.”
The day care centre has not commented publicly on the case.
Originally published as Brothers hospitalised for horrific sunburn
